website_summaries.verdict: The best budget computer fan meant for general computer builds with heavy use in mind.
pros: Extra long fan blades draw in more air than other computer fan options
Fan can be configured for pushing or pulling air, allowing for unique multi-fan setups for better airflow
cons: Fan has trouble running smoothly at higher RPMs

customer_reviews.title: loudest, most obnoxious fan i've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: i bought this to replace an NZXT case fan that's no longer in production that died, and i'm tempted to put the broken one back in after sitting with the new one for an hour. the arctic fan produces a high-pitched whine that is so perfectly tuned to the frequency that humans find annoying that it seems almost scientifically engineered to enrage. at $8 it's barely even worth the effort of returning, but i doubt i'll be purchasing any arctic fans in the future.
customer_reviews.author: a m p

customer_reviews.title: worked for a couple months then just died. wasn't ...
customer_reviews.text: worked for a couple months then just died. wasn't dusty or anything. When I finally did get it to work, it was really loud an kept spinning down. Unfortunately it died outside of Amazon's return policy. Never buying this brand again. Had another Arctic brand fan of different size that also died.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda's Book Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great Flow for the Buck
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a solid case fan used for exhausting out the top of a chassis. So this is horizontally mounted but since this is a fluid dynamic bearing it appears to be holding up better than a lot of the other fans I have used in those scenarios. Also, this fan is surprisingly quiet for the airflow it pushes. I would definitely recommend this as it was a great price for a 120mm case fan.
customer_reviews.author: TheDuke

customer_reviews.title: Great overall experience
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a replacement for the horrible included fan in a Thermaltake V3. Shipped same day, got here right away. The fan itself feels of great quality, looks nice, and sounds great. The frame material is just right for having a really tight feeling fit for the screws without being too much of a struggle to install, this is something in particular I feel they are doing better than a lot of other fan makers. Arctic F12 is just pleasant to work with, they know how to distinguish themselves in this industry.
customer_reviews.author: Astealoth

customer_reviews.title: Screws don't go in and super loud
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. The screws don't go in well. Can get it installed in the case, but not flush. This was supposed to go in the top of my case as an exhaust, but the screws that stick out make the magnetic dust filter not sit flush. Seems like a low QC hurdle for you product be properly threaded or to include the correct screws. The fan is also quite loud, much louder than my apevia case fans. Literally sounds like a box fan when you turn the PC on. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Chris K

customer_reviews.title: Great fan
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace a failing fan on a SilverStone case. The old fan was starting to wear unevenly and make rubbing sounds. This served as a great drop in replacement. All I had to do was unplug and unscrew the old fan then screw in and plug in the new fan, worked flawlessly. Not sure how the CFM of this fan compared to my old fan, but I haven't seen a noticeable change in HDD or CPU temperatures indicating less effective air flow patterns.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: My go to case fans
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these 5 packs (10 fans in total) They have a good warranty policy although I have never had to contact their support so take that for what it is The fans are great they move a fair bit of air and are not that loud I use them on a decently high FPI radiator and in some other cases. My custom loop is capable of cooling a sandy E 6 core at 1.55-1.6v though I do not recommend others try this. They are good fans for the price and I have 0 complaints for me it is either these or jumping to delta, nidec or noctua fans when the budget allows
customer_reviews.author: Nick D.

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This is a great no frills case fan. I ended up replacing the cooler master case fan that came with my case because this worked better. I ordered three and one arrived broken. They had me another one the NEXT day. Awesome customer service and warranty fulfillment. My case is smaller so I have two intake fans in the front and one exhaust at the rear and they keep things pretty cool. It is only a three pin connector but my motherboard allows me control of the fan speeds. Would recommend if you do not care about RGB's.
customer_reviews.author: Julia S.

customer_reviews.title: These fans work but you will not have quiet fans.
customer_reviews.text: 3 stars for functionality, 2 missing because of noise. Now I wish I had spent a few more dollars and did a bit more research to get quieter case fans. -- edit: I bought 2 80mm fans at the same time as these 120mm fans. The bulk of the noise was coming from the 80mm fans. While fan noise is still here, it is not as bad as I originally thought, so I'm giving back 1 star on these fans.
customer_reviews.author: B. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Great Fans!
customer_reviews.text: These fans are great. Screws for fans are included. Silver. Order the 5 pack. 1 fan is $13.49. 5 pack was $21.99. No broken fins in my box. Been using them for a few days and are much more quite than the fans that came with the Rosewill case. My 120mm CPU fan makes more noise. If you are in the market for non RGB case fans, these are the best bang for the buck.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan S

customer_reviews.title: Works as described. But has questionable quality control.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple of these on separate occasions. The single box item of the quiet (low speed) version was good. I later bought a five pack of the standard speed, and two of the five had bearing issues. Meaning, they were louder and had some vibration. It's a hit or miss on quality. In short, buy if your on a budget. I would think twice about buying from a third party seller, you might have to pay return shipping.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: New Condition!
customer_reviews.text: I really cannot review this product since I never used them. I bought them and they came new in boxes but were too big for my case. I made the mistake. I needed the 80mm fans as I have an older case but assumed these were the right size. Simple mistake on my part, but I'm sure they are good fans. I ordered the same brand in 80mm and will be trying them out tonight.
customer_reviews.author: DW

customer_reviews.title: Great and cheap fan
customer_reviews.text: Decent fans. I installed these on my Fractal Node 804 which is currently being used as an HTPC. The fans are fairly quiet, but not as silent as I would like. They hum quietly, and for my setup, they are hardly noticeable. They move a pretty good amount of air, which has been able to sufficiently cool my 8600k setup. Likely these will be the highest quality fans available for a bulk order. They also have a decent aesthetic, for what it is worth.
customer_reviews.author: NP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for vehicle applications
customer_reviews.text: I am using this fan to cool my amp racks in my Ford Flex. I have three running amps running inside the passenger cabin, so the demand on the fan is steep. It has to be very effective and very quiet. This is both! You can’t hear it even sitting in the back seat directly in front of it. Perfect! Great value too.
customer_reviews.author: JMoon54

customer_reviews.title: Went junk in about six months
customer_reviews.text: About six months after purchase the unit began exhibiting a major bearing rattle. I removed/reinstalled the unit at the time and the noise went away, but now (after a year) it is back. This time it appears I can't adjust the mounting to quiet the fan down, as it will make noise all by itself without even being mounted to anything it can transmit vibration noise to. I'm sure the vibration is also bad for the hard drives that the fan was installed to protect.
customer_reviews.author: realtimecat

customer_reviews.title: Great value for case building
customer_reviews.text: These fans are a great value. They are fairly quiet at slow to moderate speeds. I purchased them to add some circulation to my main overclocked rig. A quiet computer is important to me, and the majority of reviews here which attest to the noise level are spot on. I made sure to test each one in the pack upon receipt, and they were all functional. Attached to one of my chassis fan connectors, it spins at ~800-1000rpm and is barely audible.
customer_reviews.author: WL

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate name, not a low noise fan
customer_reviews.text: The fan moves a good amount of air so if that's your only concern, I am sure it would be satisfactory. However, the description "Low Noise" I found to be highly inaccurate. I have purchased cheaper fans than this from other brands, and found them to be significantly quieter. Even when using fan controls to reduce the RPM, it was much louder than the fan I had intended on replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Scaly

customer_reviews.title: Good airflow. But at what cost?!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a fan that was very vocal about it's decaying health. The ARCTIC F12 was so noisy, that I reinstalled the dying fan and am currently waiting for a more mainstream brand to arrive (Rosewill, for those that are interested). "Stick with a brand that you recognize," why didn't I listen?? On a different note, the airflow is, impressive. If one is looking for a good quality fan for use in a secluded environment, this is a good bet.
customer_reviews.author: T Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Ultra quite, using four of them in a custom ...
customer_reviews.text: Ultra quite, using four of them in a custom built server case. These are directly cooling twin Xeons and a half dozen disks! More than five feet away and my middle aged ears can NOT hear them. :)
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Zero noise. Period.
customer_reviews.text: Works great to cool amplifiers. Be warned, there is zero audible sound. I’ve accidentally touched it a couple times forgetting it’s there and it will remove a little divot of flesh.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just installed 3 fans in my ice castle wheelhouse they ...
customer_reviews.text: Just installed 3 fans in my ice castle wheelhouse they seem to be very quiet. Ordered the 5 pack one fan didn't work , but I installed 3 fans so I still have one spare.as stated by a previous poster the yellow wire is hot and the green wire is neutral. I had to cut off computer connect end to install.I used 3 1/2" screws to install to the center beam to space them down about 1 1/2" and just wired them into the lights.drilled a small hole in the light casing to run wires through and mahe a clean look.
customer_reviews.author: car 1234

customer_reviews.title: Too loud for me, but superb cooling
customer_reviews.text: I'm honestly surprised by the people who say this fan is quiet. I purchased 3 of them, and I thought for sure the first one I installed was defective because it was so loud. The other 2 sound exactly the same. It makes my desktop sound like a server, and is by far the loudest fan I have ever used on any computer. I will also say that the cooling was well beyond my expectations. They're amazing at moving air, but the noise was just too much for me. I did not return them because of shipping expenses where I live. I will save them for future emergency use, or to give away.
customer_reviews.author: S. Union

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, efficient
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time, in perfect shape. Used inside vehicle due to overheating computer under dash. I wouldn't recommend doing this unless you are well versed in auto, electrical and have common sense. I suspect this fan will last a long time with proper maintenance (keeping it clean). Dropped computer temp from 123° to 98° with heater running constant on high (roughly an hr of testing).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: My Liquid Cooler's exhaust fan stopped working for some reason. Bought this to replace the fan. If you never installed a fan before, I recommend checking youtube on how to install it on the motherboard. It was very easy. The fan works great. I noticed about 5-10 C drop in the temperature when gaming. Make sure to install it in the way you need the air out or in.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace a stock case fan that was going out and was getting very loud. I also purchased a more expensive competitor fan for a cup cooler and could tell the difference in quality between the two. With that said, I was more than happy with the Arctic fan and would definitely recommend this as a cheaper alternative for upgrading case fans.
customer_reviews.author: Cody C.

customer_reviews.title: Cool
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to use as cooling fans for an RV refriderator. They are super quiet, draw very little current and move a sufficient amount of air. I actually used two fans to move the quanty of air I was looking for in order to reduce condensor temps in very hot climates. Cured my problem and continue to work well.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bettendorf

customer_reviews.title: The fan can sometime make a rattle noise.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the performance to price. The aesthetics are ok and match my case fans. The fan seems to make some noise at certain rpms that sounds like the bearings are vibrating. Other than the noise at times they are perfectly priced.
customer_reviews.author: I23cl

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend these fans to anyone who wants quiet fans and ...
customer_reviews.text: I installed the fans, plugged two of them into my motherboard and they work perfectly. I can't even hear them run, but I can feel the air from the top of my computer case. It has lowered the temp of my graphics card by 10 degrees. My HDD temp has been also lowered, as well as my CPU. Would recommend these fans to anyone who wants quiet fans and great circulation to keep the inside of your case cooler.
customer_reviews.author: T. Ireland

customer_reviews.title: I am a fan :)
customer_reviews.text: I initially bought the 5-pack of F12's to act as cheap replacements should I need new fans. However, I had the mounting space so I installed all 5 of these fans as intakes to keep the dust out of the nooks and crannies. I am impressed. These fans are relatively quiet. Even on full blast, these fans manage to get a decent amount of air moving without blowing out my ear drums. I probably will not keep all 5 fans installed, but these could serve very well as cheap radiator fans to keep your system quiet. Good value for good fans.
customer_reviews.author: Dominick

customer_reviews.title: Good fans for the price.
customer_reviews.text: For a cheap fan they work very well and are not very loud at all. I hardly notice them while gaming. The install was easy, although I had to use a small drill to install them onto my case because the screws are self tapping. 4 stars seem accurate enough.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Not Quiet without PWM Feature; Get the PWM version or look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: Decent fans that have good build quality. Got them at a fantastic price ($5 each open box) however I would agree with another reviewer and say that these are by no means quiet. I bought a Cooler Master Silencio fan yesterday for my CPU and while that's definitely not a great comparison due to the cost difference, the sound difference is immense. Without PWM I would not suggest these fans. With PWM, however, I can see these being very quiet. With PWM, recommended. Without PWM, I would not recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Levy

customer_reviews.title: Not quiet when installed in the system!
customer_reviews.text: These fans have amazing airflow but they are not as quiet as they claim to be, They are more noisy (airflow noise) when installed in the computer than they are when I tested them outside the computer case I'm running them in an Antec 302 I even used Vibration Dampers around the computer case, but all the good that did when the airflow itself is noisy
customer_reviews.author: Nite

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet - if these are in a case, you're not going to hear them
customer_reviews.text: That being said, if you use these to push a lot of air through a noisy fan guard, you're going to get fan noise. if you can use a wire guard or even leafing it open, you're gonna move a ton of air and only know they're on when you look at them. Like Frank's Red Hot - I'll be using this S*#^ everywhere...
customer_reviews.author: Makrel Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Super Cooling Deal
customer_reviews.text: I have had my PC for a few years and I was starting to have issue with noisy fans and the components getting hot. Two of the fan over a weekend went completely out. This 5 pack of fans was exactly what was needed to breath fresh air into my PC (no really it was much fresher). These fans really move the air through my PC it brought the core temp of my PC way down and they are very quite as well. I could not be happier, I only wish I had done it earlier. Luckily for me these shipped super fast and my PC was offline for only one day.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: 2 out of 3 were Defective, quality control team MIA
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of them for a project. One was defective, so as always nice amazon sent me a replacement, the replacement is Defective as well. Checked with 12v battery, low amp. Charger, 12v plug. Tested with volt meter. It’s bad. It’s a lemon. I can’t even make lemonade out of it 😩😞
customer_reviews.author: Dadbeh J

customer_reviews.title: Great fans!
customer_reviews.text: It installed easy and it does what says it would do. It's quiet and keeps the temperature in control. I cannot attest to the durability of this fan as I have been using it for only a few months. They are good value. The label claims 6 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Adolfox

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great quality for the price. Used to cool my 2 Rockford Fosgate amps mounted under deck in 2005 Grand Cherokee
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement for a broken fan
customer_reviews.text: This was a great replacement for a broken fan. Great airflow but also quiet for the amount of air that it is pushing out. Easy to replace just swapped out with the old fan.
customer_reviews.author: mass

customer_reviews.title: Very Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with how quiet this fan is. My computer is close to my feet and my original fan was getting a bit noisy. I wasn't sure how much improvement this fan would be but I am very pleased with it so far. It moves a decent amount of air so it isn't ramping up and down all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Shortwaver

customer_reviews.title: Great value for 5 fans
customer_reviews.text: I was seeing single 120mm fans going for more than the price of this 5 pack! This seems like an excellent value. I've installed two as exhaust and one as intake for my new PC build. It's helped lower temperatures on my CPU by a small amount. Well worth it to have improved airflow.
customer_reviews.author: JDT

customer_reviews.title: Bought for making a hovercraft, but it seems to be a great fan otherwise.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a science project - I was trying to make a hovercraft with this and some styrofoam trays. Unfortunately I am an idiot and burned up the motor. This is a really great fan which seems to work very well for its intended purpose. If you are buying it for making a hovercraft though, maybe consider going with an RC airplane motor instead. Or at the very least have a basic understanding of voltages and how many batteries is too many!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Ellsworth

customer_reviews.title: GREAT AIRFLOW, and Quiet!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME fan! I bought two of these to replace broken fans in my Antec 900 case. These fans are really quiet for the Airflow they produce. Slightly quieter on full blast then my previous TriCool fans on full blast. and real quiet on medium power, you can barely hear them. With my motherboards' ASUS utility to keep these fans profile customed to my liking, I am getting the full experience from these guys. These 2 fans in addition to swapping out my GPU with a newer and cooler 960GTX... my CPU temp is lower by 15C, as well as ambient temp in my office down about 3C.
customer_reviews.author: Fiapop

customer_reviews.title: Quite, Yet powerful
customer_reviews.text: Dirt cheap, has a lot of speed and is whisper quiet at max, and very low in price. Can't really ask for more! I've bought 3 more since my original purchase to add to my cases.
customer_reviews.author: Azphxguy

customer_reviews.title: Fan is too noisy
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for a failed Thermaltake fan but the Arctic F12 at full speed is so noisy. Much noisier than the fan it replaced. So noisy in fact I went to Newegg and bought a different fan. Not what was advertised, very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: A bit louder than expected
customer_reviews.text: A bit louder than I had expected them to be, using these to move some air through a bookshelf on my desk that my computer and monitor are on. At 6 volts they are about the same volume as my laptop blower but (opinion) much better sound. At full power they sounded like a blow dryer on low. They look nice and seem to be pretty well balanced, I will update if/when I experience problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: CHRISO6

customer_reviews.title: Three makes a whisper
customer_reviews.text: I now have three of these in my system (plus the other that came with the CPU), and it is still barely a whisper of sound coming from the case. So much better than my previous fans. I don't often check the CPU temp, but I've never heard a bit of complaint from the system. I'm very happy with my purchases.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Holloway

customer_reviews.title: Good price and better than Stock fans
customer_reviews.text: I bought these fans to replace old Corsair stock OEM fans for my tower. All of them work but some "blow" harder than others. One blows like the fury of God, it really moves air. But 20 bucks for 5 fans......you can beat it or get too mad about the quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Massa

customer_reviews.title: Good value and reasonably quiet, just not very powerful.
customer_reviews.text: These are decent fans, not terribly loud. Unfortunately, they don't move a ton of air. I ended up replacing these with some crazy powerful Delta fans, because they just didn't cool enough. If you were putting together a home PC on a budget though, and it didn't generate a lot heat, these would probably fit the bill just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Douglas

customer_reviews.title: My GPU went from borderline overheating to cool to touch
customer_reviews.text: My GPU went from borderline overheating to cool to touch. I installed this fan when rearranging how I had placed my fans and it is working like a charm. It was an easy install and, although I also changed the direction my processor cooling fans were facing, I think that this fan is in part why my GPU is so cool when playing right now.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Carlson

customer_reviews.title: 3 of 5 developed vibration issues
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a 5 pack on 11/8/16 shipped by Amazon. Two of the fans were great but the other three were what I would call unbalanced and had a slight vibration. The vibration became worse to the point you could feel it by putting your hand on the exterior of the chassis and in April 2017 I removed those three fans and tossed them. None of the blades were missing or cracked so I can only assume they had bad and/or unbalanced motors. Didn't figure it was worth the cost to send in for replacements. Always liked Arctic fans but these were duds.
customer_reviews.author: CyberSkulls

customer_reviews.title: Works awesome
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these fans for an airbrush filter booth powered by a 12v power supply since December 2017. They're quiet even with three running, pull a good amount of air and have stood up in a pretty bad environment for a fan like this. The pre-filter catches 99% of the gunk but there's always a tad bit of bypass that the fan blades and housing collects and i've never had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: J. Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet fan
customer_reviews.text: When they say low noise, they mean low noise! I am using this fan to move air across the condenser coil on my propane fired Camper refrigerator. This resulted in 10 to 15 degree cooler temperatures in the refrigerator. So far, it is taking the punishment of a high heat outside environment.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Budget fan, MOVES A LOT OF AIR noisy as ...
customer_reviews.text: Budget fan, MOVES A LOT OF AIR noisy as hell though, only downfall is how noisy it is compaired to a cooler-master for 4$ more. Would reccomend if not worried about noise, moves a load of air
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I have this as part of a three fan setup on my desktop PC. I have two of these and one fan that came stock on my case. These two are very quiet. I can’t hear them over my stock fan or my CPU cooler. They also appear to do the job well although I can’t testify as to how they perform individually.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: I used some super glue then went ahead and mounted it
customer_reviews.text: The factory package had 5 fans in it, was made of light cardboard and no evidence of being dropped or damaged. One of the outside fans in the package had one corner broken off where the mounting screw was suppose to go. I used some super glue then went ahead and mounted it, and it seems to work fine. The factory could have used some additional stiff cardboard to protect the outside fans. The fans are quite and work well.
customer_reviews.author: informed shopper

customer_reviews.title: Moves loads of air, loud buzzing from fan, possibly received defective unit.
customer_reviews.text: Received a defective fan most likely it sounds like from reading other reviews. It pushes air like a mad fan, but there's a high pitched buzzing sound (at first I thought it was a warning buzzer from my motherboard). Amazon was quick to refund the purchase and I'm currently waiting on the replacement to arrive. Will update review once I get the replacement. Update: Replacement is perfect! Moves tons of air and doesn't make a peep!
customer_reviews.author: Nick Kingery

customer_reviews.title: Nice and quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Just installed 4 of these into my PC and they are pretty great-especially since I dislike RGB-lighting infested fans. If I set my fans to lower rpm settings when I'm casually browsing the internet or working, I can't hear these fans over my small honeywell fan that's 5 ft away from me. Even on higher settings when I'm actually gaming the sound is quite muted and no longer interferes with my gameplay. I can't say much for durability because I've only used them for 3 hours or so, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent if you want to cool and move air around
customer_reviews.text: Does very well with ventilation. Trust me I bought myself some of these and then tried another high rated more expensive brand and this beat the crap out of it in cooling. Definitely a excellent fan that get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Indira Y Grullon

customer_reviews.title: Best value for money
customer_reviews.text: Using as exhaust fan. For exhaust works perfect as high airflow and low noise. Similar fans from other brands are quite a bit more expensive, see no reason to buy those as they aren't any better.
customer_reviews.author: omszz

customer_reviews.title: Odd use, worked good.
customer_reviews.text: Not a pc guy, using these temporarily to cool a control panel on a diesel generator set. Worked well for the time they were in service.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Brought down case temps dramatically.
customer_reviews.text: Plugged right into the extra fan slot on the motherboard. Used as an exhaust fan near CPU and got decently lower readings on cpu temp after installation. Has ran quiet for about a week now.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Best silent fans for heavy use of gaming
customer_reviews.text: I love these fans, there blades have much stronger plastic material than my stock nzxt phantom 240 fans and are less louder in the same rpm and they seem to never get dirty for some reason unlike my stock fans, maybe they make the dust invisible or something but they are very cold and seem to last for a very long time. great fans would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Yasser

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for first pc build
customer_reviews.text: The noise is awesome compared to the standard fans that came with my pc case. Overall it’s pretty durable and good at its price point. Really easy to install, just don’t handle them like an ape and you won’t break them. You can also remove the stickers if you don’t want them showing and the airflow is pretty constant. I recommend them and will get more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Aylin Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet
customer_reviews.text: The fan is ultra quiet but doesn't seem to move a lot of air. I expected more of a flow from the fans, so don't expect a blowing gust from this thing.
customer_reviews.author: L. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Noisy and probably defective
customer_reviews.text: I ordered one for back of my case. It functioned ok, but made an obnoxious click every ~30s. I checked for anything interfering and it was clearly an issue with the fan. Swapped for a corsair 120mm (same size) and the noise was resolved immediately.
customer_reviews.author: JoshN

customer_reviews.title: Great potential, but missed the mark on quality
customer_reviews.text: Artic Fans are a good General Purpose Fan for lower CFM applications. Their Blades are like Razors and are extremely brittle. They have to make them this way because of the plastic formula they use. If only they used PP, PVS, ABS or even PE like other companies instead of LD PE, this product would be a 5 stars all day long. I wish they made a High Speed version of this fan.
customer_reviews.author: UZP Customs Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Cooling Item
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace a noisy case fan. This one moved an adequate amount of air quietly. Guessing it also might last longer than it's predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: ROY WINTERS

customer_reviews.title: Missing Blades
customer_reviews.text: I have never written an Amazon review but this was absolutely mind bending. I bought a value pack of five fans. Take the first one out, there is a blade missing. Well, I think, there are four more in the box, no problem. I start taking the rest out, and wow! Whoever packed this box needs their eyesight checked. All five fans were missing at least one blade while one fan was actually missing four! Not one fan in the box contained all the blades! It's like someone was on the manufacturing floor picking up the rejects and packing them.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl Leas

customer_reviews.title: I have one 140mm Antec Truequiet cooling fan and four ...
customer_reviews.text: I have one 140mm Antec Truequiet cooling fan and four 120mm Arctic f12 fans connected to my case. I can hear the 140 spinning while i cant hear the other 4 120mm which made me think they were not working, so i opened my case to see if they were working which they were, but they made very little noise that the 140mm was enough to block the noise from the 120mm.
customer_reviews.author: Juan F Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Not 74CFM, only 53CFM
customer_reviews.text: I went with these because the product description said they had a higher CFM versus similar fans. Well when I got them the box said they were the same CFM as all the other fans. So that's why 4 stars. Other than that these are nice fans and fairly quiet. They work well.
customer_reviews.author: The Chad

customer_reviews.title: Quiet once you get it working. Not a durable product.
customer_reviews.text: Might have gotten a faulty one. Got one back in february and had some noise issue that i "fixed" by loosening up the screws so the fan blades had a harder time hitting the case dust filter. Started making more noise recently and turns out a blade was tearing causing severe instability. When it was working it was great and pretty quiet, not sure about durability long term.
customer_reviews.author: brayan madera

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and effective
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 set up, 1 exhaust and 2 intakes. Run quietly and the exhaust pumps out a good amount of air.
customer_reviews.author: Damian

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: These fans are great! I picked up two for my PC and installed one on the top of the case, and the other in the front. They work great and are quiet. If you have RGB lights in your case, they will shine on the white fan which will make the fan look RGB :)
customer_reviews.author: Chester

customer_reviews.title: Way too loud and whiny
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend these to anyone who is looking for a silent computer, these are even louder than my stock case fans, they whine loudly, sounds like i'm running a bitcoin miner instead of a pc thats how loud they are.
customer_reviews.author: Khaled Armoush

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and works
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a bad fan on my PC. This went right in and powered on with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Dynaman

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent Jet Engines Fans
customer_reviews.text: I love Arctic fans. So much. I built a workstation monster for CUDA programming, and it's running Ubuntu Linux. All fun and games, except rgb fans are out. But Arctic? Oh, boy. When you get that carbon neutral box, and your box is about to have five helicopters strapped to the inside? Well, anyways, these brought my temps down by a whole lot, don't light up like the Vegas Strip, and also replaced my space heater. Five stars.
customer_reviews.author: yagrrrl

customer_reviews.title: They seem to move a decent amount of air without annoying noise levels
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these fans to replace the ones that came with my XSPC radiator, as they were worn out. They seem to move a decent amount of air without annoying noise levels. I usually run them at 5 volts unless I need extra air flow, and even at 12 volts they aren't too terribly loud, I would not hesitate to buy more of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: groundhog

customer_reviews.title: Super quiet fan, works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Super quiet fan, works perfectly. It sucks hot air from the inside and blows it out. I can feel how warm the air outtake is. It means it's doing its job well.
customer_reviews.author: Rex

customer_reviews.title: Faster and quiter than the Martech it replaced
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought two of these -- front and rear in my PC case. They run quiet enough for my needs and are moving more air than the previous fans I had. The PC is reporting cooler temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Lee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Flow to Noise Ratio
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan and a couple of others that were three times the price. Of the group, this was about as quiet as any of them, and it had noticeably higher air flow. It is great that the less expensive fan has the best performance.
customer_reviews.author: OutaSpace

customer_reviews.title: The yellow and green wires are the +ve and -ve ...
customer_reviews.text: The yellow and green wires are the +ve and -ve wires. I have run this fan from 5V to 14V. They run well, but off course the higher voltages brings more rpm. The rated voltage is 12VDC. The fan is quiet, runs with little or no vibration and moves a fair amount of air. I would purchase these fans again.
customer_reviews.author: AM

customer_reviews.title: Great Fans One of the fans arrived cracked and broken.
customer_reviews.text: Great Fans exactly what I was looking for. Would be a 5 Star Review but one of the fans came cracked and broken, and one of the fins was cracked. All the other ones worked as advertised and well.
customer_reviews.author: melanie

customer_reviews.title: to much fan noise
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was supposed to be quiet? I could hear the fan running with a high pitch something.. But it did move a lot of air but not worth the annoying noise.
customer_reviews.author: DOOGIE

customer_reviews.title: Weak air flow
customer_reviews.text: Not strong air flow. The price is kind of expensive with that kind of air flow so i return it to get stronger one .
customer_reviews.author: Benny L.

customer_reviews.title: Looks Cool and Quiet
customer_reviews.text: Great price - looks great in my gaming PC - runs quiet
customer_reviews.author: lovemyboys

customer_reviews.title: They blow air and do it without much noise. Nothing to complain about.
customer_reviews.text: They are very quiet and move a good amount of air. I have three attached to a motherboard with automatic speed control and a fourth connected to an old Zalman Fanmate to slow it down a bit. They are working very well.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Leihy

customer_reviews.title: Good backup fans
customer_reviews.text: Noise level= can’t hear them Material quality= Pretty good, not junkie but not premium Temperature control= basic. Not the best, but good for backup.
customer_reviews.author: Riley Green

customer_reviews.title: Good price.  Moves air relatively quietly without being too weak.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a fan that can move some air at a reasonable volume level. These fit the bill well enough for the dollar spent. Using these in a "bladeless" fan.
customer_reviews.author: Slushpuppy154

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: Worked like how a fan should in cooling down the pc, and for 20 bucks it's a good deal for 5 fans. Had to just use all 5 in my rig, replacing my weak exhaust fan too. Build quality is good as for the price its decent and looks nice, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tzen lee

customer_reviews.title: Watch your fingers
customer_reviews.text: These are solid fans, great fan blade material almost feels ceramic. They have been reliable and keep up with my rigs demands while looking very low profile. I wasn't about to buy nzxt fans and have them die on me 30 days later. Be careful around these as the fan blades will cut you when in motion, very precise.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: Fairly quiet and efficient
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good for the price, they did what I wanted them to do.
customer_reviews.author: William Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for 3 weeks. Runs quiet. Would buy again
customer_reviews.author: AdamY

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It's good to have a supply of these on hand if you like fixing your desktop. They are exact good replacements for OEM fans.
customer_reviews.author: M. Spiller

customer_reviews.title: Achieve cooling greatness
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, great price, and great looks. Just your basic 3 pin fan, easy to hook up, comes with screws, great balance of noise versus performance, A+
customer_reviews.author: Brandon M.

customer_reviews.title: SOOO Quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of my Thermaltake fan and all the noise it made. I put this in, and its almost whisper silent by comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Fast and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: This is a doozie! spins fast, no noise and it can be used to shred anything in the nearby area , got my index finger and pinky finger , i thought it was funny so i purchased another one. Highly recommend buying some dust filters
customer_reviews.author: Joe N.

customer_reviews.title: Low Noise, not.... then failed
customer_reviews.text: These are very noisy IMHO .. Refrigerator makes less noise. Update... very noisy, froze up Jan 2020. Changes to one star
customer_reviews.author: GetItRight

customer_reviews.title: If you don't have a rear case fan yet, definitely give this one a try.
customer_reviews.text: Had problems with my CPU hovering around 83-85c while playing games like Battlefront 2, and I didn't have money to shell out for a new cooler. For a cheaper price I was able to get this fan and a cable to split and the results were immediately noticeable. Playing Battlefront 2, I now average 71c.
customer_reviews.author: Brendin Lam

customer_reviews.title: Great first 2 months, then a blade broke free.
customer_reviews.text: Great at first, good noise reduction, BUT after 2 months one of the blades broke free and will need to get replacements. Will most likely get another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Hiroman

customer_reviews.title: Not durable!
customer_reviews.text: Had this fan less than a year and it already failed. Not worth the time and effort to return it to the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fong

product_meta.title: ARCTIC F12 - 120 mm Standard Case Fan, very quite motor, Computer, Push- or Pull Configuration, Fan Speed: 1350 RPM - Black/White
product_meta.description: Style:F12| Color:Black/WhiteARCTIC offers innovative solutions incessantly - changing impossible user requirements into new. Always focused on our customers, ARCTIC is devoted to deliver excellence through a strong dedication and a high sense of commitment. In light of the ever-changing consumer landscapes, we aspire to continue to expand and diversify our products and solutions. From computer cooling and peripherals to audio and digital home entertainment, we strive to enrich people's lives by creating innovative, user friendly yet affordable products with a great value of benefit. For us value for money is a key factor - a constant our customers rely on.
feature_bullets: INNOVATIVE DESIGN: Design of fan blades improves airflow and facilitates efficient ventilation, impeller was designed with a focus on minimzing the noise level yet delivering the desired airflow and pressure
TWO WAY INSTALLATION: Blow warm air out of the case, draw cool air into your case
LONG SERVICE LIFE: The Fluid Dynamic Bearing comes with an oil capsule that avoids lubricant leakage, thus this bearing is as quiet as a sleeve bearing but comes with a higher service life
TECHNICAL DATA: Fan speed: 1350 RPM, Airflow: 53 CFM/90.1 m³/h (@ 1350 RPM), Noise Level: 0.3 Sone (@ 1350 RPM), Pin: 3-pin

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars10,267 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
